events.description: Gold rose to around $4,830 per ounce on Friday, reversing earlier losses amid volatility.
Release of January job cuts, initial claims, and ADP payrolls data showing labor market weakness.
The White House signaled a preference for a diplomatic solution with Iran.

facts.fact_text: Gold rose to around $4,830 per ounce on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Gold rose to around $4,830 per ounce on Friday

facts.fact_text: US job cuts reached 108.4K in January, the highest for the month since 2009.

evidences.evidence_text: US job cuts reached 108.4K in January, the highest for the month since 2009

facts.fact_text: Initial claims rose to 231K and ADP payrolls missed forecasts.

evidences.evidence_text: initial claims rose to 231K and ADP payrolls missed forecasts

facts.fact_text: Gold remained on track for its second consecutive weekly loss.

evidences.evidence_text: Over the week, gold remained on track for its second consecutive weekly loss.

claims.claim_text: The string of weaker labor data reinforced expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts later this year.
claims.author: Markets
